questions.question: The lengths of the two shorter sides of a right-angled triangle are \( (3 + \sqrt{5}) \) cm and \( (4\sqrt{8} - 20) \) cm respectively. Find the area of the triangle in the form \( a(\sqrt{15} + b) \) cm\(^2\).
Given that \( \frac{d}{dx} \left( ax^2 + bx \right) = 2x + 2 \), find the values of \( a \) and \( b \).
The equation of a curve is \( y = \frac{2}{x^2} - 1 \). Find an expression for \( \frac{dy}{dx} \).
Using the result in (i) above, explain, with working, why the curve \( y = \frac{2}{x^2} - 1 \) has no turning points.
The diagram shows the straight line graph obtained by plotting \( y \) against \( \frac{1}{x} \). The line passes through the points \((-1, 1)\) and \((4, 11)\). Express \( y \) in terms of \( x \).

An experiment on the discharge of an electrical circuit was conducted. It is known that \( V \) volts, the voltage of the electrical circuit and \( t \) seconds, the elapsed time since the removal of the power source, are related by the equation \( V = Ae^{kt} \), where \( A \) and \( k \) are constants. The table below shows corresponding values of \( t \) and \( V \). \( t: 1.0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.5, 3.0 \) \( V: 2.80, 2.20, 1.35, 1.39, 1.10 \) (i) On the grid given in page 9, plot a straight line to illustrate this data. Use the graph to estimate the values of \( A \) and \( k \).
Estimate the initial voltage of the electrical circuit.

It was subsequently discovered that one of the readings was wrongly recorded in the table. Using the graph, determine which value of \( V \), in the table above, is the incorrect recording. Estimate a value of \( V \) to replace the incorrect recording of \( V \).
Find the range of values of \( p \) for which the equation \( x^2 + 6x + 2 = 9p - px \) has real and distinct roots.
Using your answer in (i), deduce whether the curve \( y = (x+3)^2 \) will meet the line \( y = 18 - 9x \).

A manufacturer makes closed right cylindrical cans with a volume of 320 \text{ cm}^3 each. The material for the top and bottom of the cylinder costs 3 cents per 10 \text{ cm}^2 while the sides of the container costs 2 cents per 10 \text{ cm}^2. The diagram shows a cylindrical can with radius r cm and height h cm.
(a) Show that h = \frac{320}{\pi r^2}.
(b) Assuming there is no wastage of materials during production, show that the cost of producing a can, P (in cents), can be expressed as P = 2\pi r^2 + \frac{1280}{r}.
(c) Find the dimensions of each cylindrical can the manufacturer must use so that the cost of production is a minimum. Give your answers to 1 decimal place.
(d) Hence, write down the minimum cost of producing one can, to the nearest cent.
(a) Use the substitution u = 3^x to solve the equation (3^x)^2 + 3^{x-1} = 3.
(b) Solve the equation 5 \log 2x + \log 5 = 4 \log (x - 1) + 2.
(c) (i) Sketch the graph of y = \ln x for x > 0, indicating the x-intercept.

(c) (ii) Amy wishes to find the number of solutions to the equation e^{2x} = 1 by inserting a suitable line onto the sketch of y = \ln x in (i). Find the equation of the line to be drawn onto the sketch.
